title: Where will Kristian Campbell play in the field for the Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kristian Campbell will primarily play in the outfield for the Red Sox in 2026, moving away from second base.
Campbell struggled at second base defensively in 2025, recording a minus-16 defensive runs saved and seeing a decline offensively.
The Red Sox face a crowded outfield with four players competing for three spots, affecting Campbell's path to regular play.

title: Jayson Tatum remains noncommittal about returning this season for Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum remains noncommittal about returning to the Celtics this season after recovering from an Achilles injury.
Tatum participated in practice with the Maine Celtics but hasn't guaranteed a return for the 2025-26 season.
The Celtics are tied for second in the Eastern Conference despite Tatum's absence, with a current record of 34-19.

title: Mass. Education Secretary Patrick Tutwiler to step down in latest departure from Healey cabinet
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Patrick Tutwiler to resign as Massachusetts Education Secretary to lead Walker Therapeutic & Educational Programs.
Stephen Zrike, Salem Schools Superintendent, appointed to succeed Tutwiler and will start his new role in March.
Tutwiler joins other recent cabinet departures, including past Transport and Public Safety Secretaries under Gov. Maura Healey.

title: Drake Maye says marrying young was ‘one of the best things I’ve experienced in my life’
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye shared appreciation for marrying young, calling it a positive experience in his life.
Maye and his wife Ann Michael began dating in middle school and married on June 21, 2025, in North Carolina.
The couple's relationship was highlighted during Super Bowl week, emphasizing personal stability alongside his professional football career.

title: 23 queer romance books perfect for Valentineâ€™s Day reading
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The Boston.com article provides a queer romance book guide using a matrix format inspired by the Approval Matrix.
The matrix categorizes 23 queer romance novels by spice level and tone, ranging from light to dark themes.
The guide includes genres like gothic, historical, and sports romances, catering to a variety of readers' preferences.

title: Will Campbell talks poor Super Bowl performance, avoiding media, and more
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell received criticism for allowing 14 pressures in the Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl LX loss to Seattle.
Campbell, the fourth overall pick in 2025, apologized for avoiding media post-game due to emotional intensity.
Coach Mike Vrabel confirmed Campbell will remain as left tackle, dismissing a move to another position.

title: Mike Vrabel on the Patriots’ foundation, his view of the 2025 season, and Will Campbell’s future
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel reflects on the season, emphasizing the team's strong foundation despite losing Super Bowl LX.
Vrabel reassures that left tackle Will Campbell, despite criticisms, will remain in his position and continue to develop.
Defensive coordinator Terrell Williams is set to return after battling cancer, raising questions about Zak Kuhr's role.

title: Boston to host FIFA World Cup Fan Fest at City Hall Plaza
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu announced the FIFA World Cup Fan Festival at City Hall Plaza in downtown Boston.
The festival will feature live entertainment, local food, and serve as a gathering space for fans not attending matches.
The World Cup matches in Foxborough are expected to generate $100 million in tax revenue and over 9,000 jobs.

title: Are MBTA commuters destined to suffer for the rest of the winter?
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: MBTA faces delays and cancellations due to winter conditions, with efforts to improve future storm resilience underway.
Older Red Line cars are essential to meet demand, despite performance issues in single-digit temperatures, says MBTA.
MBTA introduces measures like acquiring 'crib heaters' to mitigate weather impacts on service, while urging rider patience.

title: Wu says she would vote for statewide rent control through proposed ballot question
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu supports a proposed ballot question for statewide rent control, despite preferring a local option.
The ballot measure proposes tying rent hikes to cost of living, capping increases at 5% annually, with some exceptions.
Opposition, including Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey, argues rent control hinders housing construction; a lawsuit seeks to disqualify the measure.
